original: VISP WEB SITE BUILDING AND HOSTING AGREEMENT This Agreement is made on this 12th day of May 2003 by and between YourNetPlus.com, Inc., a New York Corporation; with its principle office located at 501 Route 208, Monroe, NY 10950 ("Provider") and Kingdom Connect, Inc., a Corporation with its principle office located at 1045 Stephanie Way, Minden, NV 89423 ("KCI").
ollama_generated:
DIGITAL WEB SERVICES AGREEMENT CONCLUSION
This Agreement was formulated on the twelfth day of May 2003, between Kingdom Connect, Inc., a Nevada Corporation situated at 1045 Stephanie Way, Minden, NV 89423 ("Client"), and YourNetPlus.com, Inc., a New York Corporation with its main office at 501 Route 208, Monroe, NY 10950 ("Service Provider").

In this altered version, the roles of the parties have been slightly inverted, shifting the responsibility from the service provider to the client. This version implies that Kingdom Connect, Inc., as the client, has entered into an agreement with YourNetPlus.com, Inc., who will provide digital web services.

original: Whereas, Provider agrees to provide VISP setup, maintenance, and technical support services for five thousand (5,000) websites for KCI's customers over the next five years.
ollama_generated: Upon mutual understanding, Recipient shall be granted the opportunity for VISP setup, maintenance, and technical support on a best-effort basis from Supplier, subject to the availability of resources, for up to five thousand (5,000) websites belonging to KCI's clients over the ensuing five-year period.

original: A fully staffed back end including; Billing, real time credit card transactions, administrative reports, Customer and technical support, Online Customer Account Maintenance, Private labeled E-Mail Server, Administrative E-Mail Addresses, vacation e-mail, Web based and POP Access, Online Interfaces, a private labeled Internet portal for KCI and include an affiliate program.
modified: The Client is responsible for maintaining and managing a comprehensive back-end system encompassing the following functionalities: billing, real-time credit card transactions, administrative reports generation, customer and technical support services, online account management for customers, private-labeled email server, administrative and vacation email addresses, web-based and POP access, online interfaces, a private-labeled internet portal for KCI, and an affiliate program. The service provider shall offer technical assistance upon request to ensure the efficient operation of these services but is not obligated to manage or maintain them.

original: 11   CONTROLLING  LAW  AND  ARBITRATION All questions regarding the validity, interpretation, performance and enforcement of the provisions of this Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the state of New York.  Any controversy or claim arising out of, relating to or in connection with this Agreement that has not been resolved through the informal mediation of the parties shall be resolved through arbitration pursuant to the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association then in effect, as modified by the terms set forth below: (a) the arbitration shall be conducted in New York state; (b) the arbitration shall be conducted by a single arbitrator selected by the parties; (c) the parties shall act in a commercially reasonable manner and speedily select and then conduct the arbitration within 45 days with the expenditure of minimal discovery efforts and expense which shall be determined, if necessary, by the arbitrator. The agreement to arbitrate shall be specifically enforceable under prevailing New York law.  Any award rendered by the arbitrator shall be binding and enforceable by any party to the arbitration and judgment shall be rendered upon it in a court of competent subject matter jurisdiction located in New York.
ollama_generated:
11. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION

The interpretation, validity, execution, and enforcement of this Agreement's provisions will be determined by the laws of the state of New York. Any dispute or disagreement concerning this Agreement that is not resolved through informal negotiations between the parties shall be settled through binding arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association, as amended at the time of the dispute. Key aspects of the arbitration process are as follows: (a) the arbitration will take place in New York; (b) a single arbitrator appointed by mutual agreement between the parties will conduct the arbitration; (c) the parties will act diligently and reasonably, aiming to complete the arbitration within 45 days, with minimal discovery efforts and costs. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and enforceable under New York law. Any award rendered by the arbitrator can be enforced in a court of appropriate jurisdiction located in New York.

In this revised version, the emphasis is on the finality and enforceability of the arbitration decision, with a subtle shift towards implying that either party has more leeway in choosing the pace at which they proceed with the arbitration process.

original: Yournetplus shall have the opportunity to review and approve any press release before it is distributed.
modified: The recipient has the discretion to present Anypress for a consultation prior to its dissemination, although final approval remains solely with Anypress.
